questions.question_text:
Universal Containers uses over 45,000 different Container Product records with CPQ. When a sales rep views the Add Products page, a list of the first 2,000 Products is displayed in a disorganized manner. The product management team wants the products to display in collapsible groups based on the product family.
How should a CPQ Specialist enable this functionality from the Salesforce CPQ managed package configuration settings?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It says real time so it has to be on Edit and not save

CHOOSE A. Evaluation Scope = Configurator: This means that the rule will evaluate in the context of the configuration process, which is what you want when users are selecting options in the bundle. It allows the rule to react immediately to changes made in the configuration UI. Evaluation Event = Edit: By setting the evaluation event to Edit, the Price Rule will trigger every time the user makes an edit (such as selecting or changing Product Option A). This allows for real-time updates to be reflected in Product Option B's quantity as the user interacts with the configuration interface.

choices.A:
Evaluation Scope = Configurator -
Configurator Evaluation Event = Edit
choices.C:
Evaluation Scope = Configurator -
Configurator Evaluation Event = Save
choices.D:
Evaluation Scope = Calculator -
Calculator Evaluation Event = Edit
choices.B:
Evaluation Scope = Calculator -
Calculator Evaluation Event = Save
